thread.title: Atletico boss Diego Simeone says he felt 'a noise' as Fernando Torres was knocked unconscious in Deportivo clash
thread.title_full: Atletico boss Diego Simeone says he felt 'a noise' as Fernando Torres was knocked unconscious in Deportivo clash

author: James Whaling
title: Atletico boss Diego Simeone says he felt 'a noise' as Fernando Torres was knocked unconscious in Deportivo clash
text:
Sport Atletico boss Diego Simeone says he felt 'a noise' as Fernando Torres was knocked unconscious in Deportivo clash The striker clashed with Alex Bergantinos in the closing stages of the La Liga fixture, receiving treatment on the pitch before being taken to hospital Share Simeone reacts on the touchline after Torres' blow (Photo: AFP) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone says he felt 'a noise' from the bench as Fernando Torres was knocked unconscious in their 1-1 draw with Deportivo. 
The striker clashed with Alex Bergantinos in the closing stages of the La Liga fixture, receiving treatment on the pitch before being taken to hospital. 
Atletico later confirmed Torres is 'stable and conscious'. 
"Worried, nervous, are the feelings after a blow as strong as he has received," Simeone said. Torres' teammates attend to the striker (Photo: REUTERS) The former Liverpool man is put on a stretcher (Photo: REUTERS) 
"I felt a noise from the bench, I do not know if it was the neck, but something felt, these are unfortunate situations that happen in the game." 
Torres was stretchered off in a neck brace and is set to spend the night in hospital to undergo further tests. 
The former Liverpool and Chelsea forward was a second-half substitute for Atleti as they dropped points at one of the division's strugglers. Torres left in an ambulance (Photo: REUTERS) Read More 
Torres' teammate Antoine Griezmann added: "I dont really care now about football or the result, only worried about Fernando's health at moment. 
"I hope he's OK and back soon." Like us on Facebook
